intro: Pycreus camagueyensis, commonly known as the Caysan pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the subtropical climate of its native region. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, providing a textured appearance, while its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
